meanings.definition: A type of sled used by Native American tribes for transporting goods
meanings.sent1: The travois helped the tribe carry heavy loads across the snowy terrain.
meanings.sent2: The hunters loaded their catch onto the travois and pulled it back to the village.
meanings.sent3: The playful children pretended the travois was a magical flying carpet.
meanings.sent4: The travois glided over the ground like a graceful swan on water.
meanings.sent5: The intricate design of the travois made it a work of art as well as a practical tool.

meanings.definition: To transport goods using a travois
meanings.sent1: They would travois their belongings to the new campsite before sunset.
meanings.sent2: The villagers decided to travois the supplies to the neighboring settlement.
meanings.sent3: The siblings playfully raced each other to see who could travois the fastest.
meanings.sent4: She travoised the packages with such speed and efficiency that everyone was impressed.
meanings.sent5: The team travoising the equipment worked together like a well-oiled machine.
